org.xbib.elasticsearch.river.jdbc

Interface RiverMouth<RC extends RiverContext>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ColumnRiverMouth, SimpleRiverMouth

    public interface RiverMouth<RC extends RiverContext>
    The river mouth is the abstraction of the destination where all the data is flowing from the river source.

    • Method Summary

      • index

        void index(IndexableObject object,
         boolean create)
           throws IOException
        Index operation. Indicating that an object has been built and is ready to be indexed. The source of the document is held by the XContentBuilder.
        Parameters:
        object - the indexable object
        create - true if the document should be created
        Throws:
        IOException - when indexing fails

      • delete

        void delete(IndexableObject object)
            throws IOException
        Delete operation. Indicating that an object should be deleted from the index.
        Parameters:
        object - the structured object
        Throws:
        IOException - when delete fails

      • flush

        void flush()
           throws IOException
        Flush data to the river mouth
        Throws:
        IOException - when flush fails

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
              throws IOException
        Shutdown river mouth and release all resources, e.g. bulk processor and client
        Throws:
        IOException

      • suspend

        void suspend()
             throws Exception
        Suspend river mouth. Do not proceed with indexing and wait for resume.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • resume

        void resume()
            throws Exception
        Resume river mouth after suspend.
        Throws:
        Exception
